module.name: Prj_Homework
module.short: A Program by Thaddy as an example for a homework

element.name: proc1
element.short: The procedure proc1 makes a beep (normaly a sound)

element.name: func1
element.short: The function func1 results a random boolean with both a 50% chance of true or false

element.name: func2
element.short: The function func2 always returns a true-value

element.name: f
element.short: The char-variable f is needed to iterate through the string e and for display on each step

element.name: a
element.short: the variable a get assigned the value of function func1 and later compared to variable b

element.name: b
element.short: First variable b will be assigned the value of function func1, and later b will be used to iterate from false to true

element.name: c
element.short: the integer-variable c with the default-value of 100 is compared to the rounded value of d

element.name: d
element.short: the float-variable d with single accuracy and the default value of 100.1 is rounded and then compared to the variable c

element.name: e
element.short: the string-variable e with the default value of 'Finished homework' is used in the end of the program to be iterated trough by f

module.descr:
First the program initialises the random function. then the program compares the rounded value of d to the value of c.
-> this comparison always results in true, so the inner block is executed. in the inner block b gets assinged the value of function func1
-> that will be a boolean with a 50% chance of each true or false. then b will be compared to the result of function func2
-> function func2 always returns true, so you have a 50% chance for executing the then or else-path of the program. in the (true) then-path the case-command get executed which takes the value of b and... in case of a true-value it executes proc1 and
in case of a false-value it executes proc2.
since you only get here when b equals func2 (=true) the false branch never gets executed.
by callin proc1 the program beeps. in the else-branch of the comparison of b to the value of func2,
b is now used to iterate from false to true. For every iteration : 2) middle block b is then compared to the result of func1, which is a new boolean with 50%chance of each true or false.
if the comparison succeds the most inner block is executed otherwise the iteration is continued. 3) most inner block
a is assigned a result of function func1 (random value above-mentioned ).
This value is compared to the value of b.
This inner block is repeated until the value a equals the value of b Then the middle block is repeated. After the iteration the else-branch is finished.
In the next command, char-variable f will be used to iterate through the string-variable e.
So for every character of the String 'Finished homework' the write-command is called with that character.
Meaning the string is printed to the Screen letter by letter. At least with readln the program request the user to enter something, followed by a <>. Then the program terminates.
